Package primitives

Class Vector

java.lang.Object
primitives.Vector
Direct Known Subclasses:
NormalizedVector
public class Vector
extends java.lang.Object
The Vector class represents a Vector with it's base at the origin and it's head at the Point 'head'.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Vector​(double x, double y, double z)
    This constructor accepts 3 doubles and returns the appropriate Vector
    Vector​(Point head)
    This constructor accepts a Point and returns the appropriate Vector

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Vector add​(Vector v)
    Adds two Vectors and returns a new Vector.
    double angle​(Vector v)
    Calculates the angle in radians between this vector and the given vector.
    Vector cross​(Vector v)
    Calculates the cross product of two Vectors.
    double dot​(Vector v)
    Calculates the dot product of two Vectors
    boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
    Checks if the two Vectors have the same magnitude and direction.
    int hashCode()
    Computes the hash function based on that of Point.
    double length()
    Calculates the length of this Vector.
    NormalizedVector normalized()
    Creates a new Vector with the same direction as this one but with a magnitude of one.
    Vector reversed()
    An alias for scale(double) with factor -1.
    Vector scale​(double factor)
    Constructs a new Vector which is a scalar multiplication of this Vector by a scalar.
    double squareLength()
    Calculates the square of the length of this Vector.
    Vector subtract​(Vector vector)
    Subtracts two Vectors and returns a new Vector.
    java.lang.String toString()
    Returns the head of the Vector as a string.
    Vector transform​(java.util.function.DoubleBinaryOperator transformation, Vector aux)
    Creates a new Vector which is a transformation of this Vector by applying the given transformation to each of the coordinates.
    Vector transform​(java.util.function.DoubleUnaryOperator transformation)
    Similar to transform(DoubleBinaryOperator, Vector) but does not require an auxiliary Vector, since the transformation when called in this way does not depend on a second coordinate.

  • Constructor Details

    • Vector

      public Vector​(double x, double y, double z)
      This constructor accepts 3 doubles and returns the appropriate Vector
      Parameters:
      x - The value of the x coordinate.
      y - The value of the y coordinate.
      z - The value of the z coordinate.
      Throws:
      ZeroVectorException - if the Vector is the zero vector.

    • Vector

      public Vector​(Point head)
      This constructor accepts a Point and returns the appropriate Vector
      Parameters:
      head - The Point which this Vector would point to if its base was at the origin.
      Throws:
      ZeroVectorException - if this Vector is the zero vector.

  • Method Details

    • transform

      public Vector transform​(java.util.function.DoubleBinaryOperator transformation, Vector aux)
      Creates a new Vector which is a transformation of this Vector by applying the given transformation to each of the coordinates.
      Parameters:
      transformation - A function which receives two doubles and returns another double.
      aux - An auxiliary Vector whose corresponding coordinate may (or may not) be used in the transformation function in order to calculate each of the new coordinates.
      Returns:
      The Vector made up of applying the transformation to each of the three coordinates.
      Throws:
      ZeroVectorException - if the transformation results in the zero vector.

    • transform

      public Vector transform​(java.util.function.DoubleUnaryOperator transformation)
      Similar to transform(DoubleBinaryOperator, Vector) but does not require an auxiliary Vector, since the transformation when called in this way does not depend on a second coordinate.
      Parameters:
      transformation - A function which receives a dingle double and returns another double.
      Returns:
      The Vector made up of applying the transformation to each of the three coordinates.
      Throws:
      ZeroVectorException - if the transformation results in the zero vector.

    • add

      public Vector add​(Vector v)
      Adds two Vectors and returns a new Vector.
      Parameters:
      v - The Vector which is to be added to this Vector.
      Returns:
      The sum of the two Vectors.
      Throws:
      ZeroVectorException - when adding a Vector with its reverse.

    • subtract

      public Vector subtract​(Vector vector)
      Subtracts two Vectors and returns a new Vector.
      Parameters:
      vector - The Vector to be subtracted from this Vector.
      Returns:
      The sum of this Vector and the negation of the given Vector.
      Throws:
      ZeroVectorException - if a Vector is subtracted from itself.

    • scale

      public Vector scale​(double factor)
      Constructs a new Vector which is a scalar multiplication of this Vector by a scalar.
      Parameters:
      factor - The scalar by which to multiply this Vector
      Returns:
      New scaled Vector
      Throws:
      ZeroVectorException - if the scale factor is zero.

    • reversed

      public Vector reversed()
      An alias for scale(double) with factor -1.
      Returns:
      New reversed Vector

    • cross

      public Vector cross​(Vector v)
      Calculates the cross product of two Vectors.
      Parameters:
      v - The Vector by which to multiply this Vector
      Returns:
      The resulting Vector which is the cross product of the two Vectors
      Throws:
      ZeroVectorException - if the result vector is the zero vector.

    • dot

      public double dot​(Vector v)
      Calculates the dot product of two Vectors
      Parameters:
      v - The Vector to dot product with this Vector
      Returns:
      The dot product of the two Vectors

    • length

      public double length()
      Calculates the length of this Vector.
      Returns:
      The length of this Vector.

    • squareLength

      public double squareLength()
      Calculates the square of the length of this Vector.
      Returns:
      The square of the length of this Vector.

    • normalized

      public NormalizedVector normalized()
      Creates a new Vector with the same direction as this one but with a magnitude of one.
      Returns:
      new Vector

    • angle

      public double angle​(Vector v)
      Calculates the angle in radians between this vector and the given vector. The angle is normalized between zero and Pi.
      Parameters:
      v - The other vector to be used to calculate the angle.
      Returns:
      The angle in radians between the vectors between zero and Pi.

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
      Checks if the two Vectors have the same magnitude and direction.
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Computes the hash function based on that of Point.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class java.lang.Object

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the head of the Vector as a string.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
